content:
Hi all,

Thanks so much for attending the first three lectures and participating so actively in the Q&A and Zulip! Coming Monday, I'll be giving the fourth lecture on Geometric Deep Learning & Naturality

This seminar is held Monday October 31st on 4PM UTC. Please note that this is a different UTC offset from last lecture.
The zoom link to join the lecture is: https://uva-live.zoom.us/j/83816139841.
The lecture will also be live-streamed to https://youtu.be/2tPcSYLBnxg and be permanently available there afterwards.

See you on Monday!
Pim

Hi all, just a reminder that this lecture starts in little under an hour!

Thought I'd just write it here since there might be some confusion over the daylight savings time which happened this Sunday in the UK. It might be the case that the calendar invite didn't update properly for some of you (if you've subscribed using the .ical file instead of clicking on the link)

In case your calendar had the wrong time (which I assume was due to usage of the .ical file), you can get the updated calendar here (this is the same link as the one in the original email). If you use this link all future changes to the schedule should be automatically visible.
In the lecture, Pim said he can provide some overview papers on whether Equivariant NNs outperform traditional NNs on certain tasks. Would be nice to take a look!
https://arxiv.org/abs/2201.02756 categorical hopfield networks may be off interest
